title: Live news: The week ahead
FirstFT: Biden seeks to reassure Ukraine after Congress jettisons $6bn in aid
description: Also in today’s newsletter, VCs tell start-ups to delay IPO plans and tensions rise between Bangladesh and the west

title: Hunt to pledge minimum wage rise and benefit sanctions
description: UK chancellor will promote ‘workers versus shirkers’ narrative in attempt to shift focus from high tax

title: Biden tries to reassure Ukraine as war aid becomes domestic battleground
description: Support for Kyiv is under fire as Republicans tie further funding to efforts to secure Southern border

title: Poland opposition takes to streets as hard-fought election looms
description: Donald Tusk’s party seeks momentum as Kaczyński’s rightwing ruling party leads polls

title: Corporate fraud cases, election speeches and jobs data
description: FTX’s Sam Bankman-Fried and Co-operative Bank’s Paul Flowers go on trial and UK conference season continues

title: BAE Systems wins £3.95bn contract to build next generation nuclear submarines
description: The ships being built as part of the Aukus security pact will bring jobs and investment to Cumbria

title: Global lessons from inflation’s rise above the UK target
description: Errors in hitting central bank goals are likely to be asymmetric with a drift upwards that leads to recession

title: UK retailers demand protection from  shoplifting surge
description: Employers say violence and abuse of staff is on the rise and call on the police to prioritise a response

title: Republican hardliner moves to oust McCarthy over deal to avert shutdown
description: Party’s far-right angry over compromise with Democrats that keeps government funded another 45 days

title: Saudi Arabia predicts budget deficit as it funnels money into gigaprojects
description: Preliminary budget statement pares growth forecast for this year to 0.03%

title: Some Republican donors worry legal troubles will win nomination for Trump
description: Former US president’s lead over Republican rivals grows as prosecutors lay out cases against him

title: Is the US jobs market slowing?
description: Market Questions is the FT’s guide to the week ahead

title: Germany must invest to neutralise the far-right threat
description: A once successful growth model has run out of steam and migrants are needed to fill labour market shortages

title: Russia and North Korea are baring their teeth
description: By dangling the threat of military co-operation, the two states are probably warning Seoul not to arm Ukraine

title: Sunak will not commit to tax cuts as fractious Tory conference starts
description: Prime minister says beating inflation is the priority despite pressure from his party to make pre-election giveaway

title: It is right to shed light on opaque private capital markets
description: Authorities need to monitor valuation practices to better assess risks in the industry

title: Suicide bombing hits Turkish capital Ankara
description: Two suspects dead after attack on interior ministry

title: Recycling: plastics are a bottle neck in the war on waste
description: The rush to meet self-imposed targets on reduction and reuse has yielded few results

title: Robert Fico wins Slovakia election with anti-Ukraine stance
description: Former prime minister set to try to form coalition that could undermine EU support for Kyiv

title: British exporters face hefty EU carbon tax bill after Sunak weakens climate policies
description: UK carbon market collapse lets Brussels benefit from revenues that would previously have gone to Treasury

title: EU payment rules shake-up will prompt price rises, retailers warn
description: Brussels plan aimed at aiding SMEs will also lead businesses to source more goods from China, say industry groups

title: Georgia’s reluctance to move against Russian agent tests its allegiance to west
description: Former chief prosecutor was put on a US sanctions list for doing Moscow’s bidding in the Caucasus nation

title: Germans shrug off economic gloom at booming Oktoberfest
description: Record numbers of drinkers are flocking to the Theresienwiese fairground despite the soaring cost of beer

title: Korea Zinc expands nickel production to meet US battery demand
description: Plant under construction would make South Korean company the largest non-Chinese producer of nickel sulphate

title: Maybe politics should be more mindful
description: It’s easy to mock the practice but it could help politicians be less reactive, act with more conviction and disagree better

title: Merkel’s policies left Germany too reliant on Russian gas, adviser admits
description: Top economics aide says the ex-chancellor had little choice after deciding to phase out nuclear power

title: New Brexit border checks to cost business £320mn a year
description: Minister’s letter to Labour MP sets out government forecast as companies warn of food price rises

title: The ghastly modern office needs a reboot
description: Hybrid working has exposed wasteful, outdated designs that one Silicon Valley boss wants to blow up

title: Turkey calls on Sweden to take more ‘concrete measures’ before joining Nato
description: Ankara seeks further action against extremists as parliament reconvenes to consider accession request
